climbs.name: The Substantial Sloth
climbs.fa: Unknown. First recorded ascent: Will O., Sage P., & Brandon C.

content.description: Stand start with a large in-cut at chest height. Climb up to a huge positive ledge before traversing right across similar features to top out.
content.location: Far right side of the outcrop, right of Roly-Poly.

climbs.name: Roly-Poly
climbs.fa: Unknown. First recorded ascent: Brandon C.

content.description: SDS with two sloping edges. A single tension-dependent move leads to positive holds and a mellow top out.Â
content.location: Right of Knee-High for a Gnat

climbs.name: Queen Mother
climbs.fa: Unknown. First recorded ascent: Will O.

content.description: SDS with two large side-pulls. Establish and head left gaining a slopey seam, then up through sloping edges to a difficult lip encounter. Sharp and Powerful.
content.location: Far left end of the outcrop.

climbs.name: Knee-High for a Gnat
climbs.fa: Unknown. First recorded ascent: Will O., Sage P., & Brandon C.

content.description: SDS matched on an incut in the center of the face. Climb directly up to an powerful crux guarding the top out. Good movement striking a fun balance of power and technique.
content.location: Center of the outcrop, right of Queen Mother

climbs.name: For the Queen
climbs.fa: Unknown. First recorded ascent: Will O.

content.description: SDS with two right facing fins. Climb up and right through edge features to a technical lip encounter

climbs.name: Diminutive
climbs.fa: Unknown. First recorded ascent: Will O.

content.description: SDS as for Knee-High to a Gnat on a high incut. Climb left on smaller edges, and top out as for For the Queen
content.location: Center of the outcrop, right of For the Queen.

climbs.name: Broad in the Beam
climbs.fa: Unknown. First recorded ascent: Sage P. & Brandon C.

content.description: SDS with two small edges. A powerful move leads to mellow climbing on big features. This climb shares a top out with The Substantial Sloth.

A long, north facing overhang on the right side of the valley. This surprisingly featured section of rock offers a great selection of climbs of accessible difficulty, making it an ideal spot to warm-up before heading to other smaller outcrops.
